intro: Gynochthodes bartlingii, commonly known as the Bartling's gynochthodes, is a rare and little-known species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
